title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A sporadically loses green light/does not power on
message:
Hello everyone. 

Sorry for writing it before measuring everything, but during the first-look test laptop booted and i've decided to extract customer's data before proceeding since it started wit the battery disconnected. 
i have two days off, so i am reading schematics to figure out what could be a reason for such a weird behaviour.

J2550 had corrosion around pins 44-64, nothing suspicious more. 
triggering SMC reset turned off orange led instead of switching it to green. 
could not find schematics for charging board (io board?), so i would appreciate some tips for onewire troubleshooting.

title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A sporadically loses green light/does not power on
message: No schematic for IO board. The first thing here is to inspect the J4700, IO board and flat cable for corrosion, best to just replace IO board/cable in doubt.

title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A sporadically loses green light/does not power on
message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 31985"]No schematic for IO board. The first thing here is to inspect the J4700, IO board and flat cable for corrosion, best to just replace IO board/cable in doubt.[/QUOTE]
Thanks, i will test it with other board as soon as i get one. 
is there some MB Pro board which could have a schematic close enough to troubleshoot it instead of simply replacing it?

title: MacBook Air 13" 2011 820-3023-A sporadically loses green light/does not power on
message: There are no diagrams for any IO boards for this stuff. These are $15 so no use to even waste 10 minutes on them. Only thing you can quickly do is inspect the connectors for corrosion.
